document.masterDocTitle: Systematics and convergent evolution in three Australian genera of Pepsinae spider wasps (Hymenoptera: Pompilidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Maurillus Smith, 1855: 170
( type species:
Maurillus australis Smith, 1855
, by monotypy).

The genus includes two species, which occur in Australia:
Maurillus argenticapitis Pitts & Shimizu
, sp. nov. and
M. australis Smith, 1855
.

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 2.
Maurillus australis Smith
, holotype female. (a) Head, anterior view; (b) clypeus and mandible, anterior view; (c) head and anterior part of mesosoma, lateral view; (d) scape, dorsal (above) and lateral view (below); (e) head and anterior part of pronotum, dorsal view; (f) posterior part of propodeum and metasoma, dorsal view; (g) fore and hind wings; (h) posterior part of mesosoma and anterior part of metasoma, dorsolateral view; (i) apical part of right fore tibia, medial view; and (j) hind tibia, dorsal view. Scale bars: 1 mm. ((d), (i) and (j) lack scale bars (no measurement data available due to lack of access to the holotype).)

subSubSection.paragraph: This genus differs from other Australian ‚ÄòCtenocerini‚Äô sensu Evans (1972) by the following female features: clypeus much narrower than lower frons, truncate apically ( Figs 1a and 2a ); labrum fully exserted, directed backward at right angle to clypeus ( Figs 1b and 2b ); lower frons laterally to antennal sockets with deep depressions continuous with sublateral depressions of clypeus; vertex abnormally convex, extended far above eye tops and ocelli, distance from eye top to vertex crest, in profile, at least two-fifths of eye height ( Figs 1c and 2c ); scape unusual in structure ( Figs 1b,d and 2d ) with triangular or rectangular in cross-section, its apicomedial corner subacutely produced beyond origin of flagellum, with medial face flattened or concave, smooth and polished and lateral face strongly concave; gena in dorsal view very thick, roughly rectangular ( Figs 1d and 2e ); and pronotum with anterior face vertical, flattened and polished, forming right angle with disc ( Figs 1c and 2c ), and anterior margin of pronotal disc truncate, tuberculate submedially, depressed medially.

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 3. Maurilloides nigrisoma
, sp. nov. , holotype female. (a) Head, anterior view; (b) head and anterior part of mesosoma, dorsal view; (c) head and anterior part of mesosoma, dorsolateral view; (d) scape, dorsal view; (e) head and mesosoma, lateral view; (f) left hind pretarsus, lateral view; (g) metapostnotum and propodeum, posterodorsal view; (h) fore wing; (i) posterior part of mesosoma and metasoma, dorsal view; and (j) posterior part of propodeum and metasoma, lateral view. Scale bars: 0.1 mm for (f) and 1 mm for others.

subSubSection.paragraph: Pronotum with dorsum flattened and declivous ( Figs 1c and 2c ), in anterior view V-shaped emargination above; shoulder swollen ( Fig. 1d,g ). Mesoscutum flattened, not reflexed posterolaterally. Discs of scutellum and metanotum flattened at same level as mesoscutum. Propodeum short, rugose on both dorsum and posterior declivity, latter being flattened for reception of anterior face of T1, longer than dorsum, separated from dorsum by sharp carina ( Figs 1e and 2h ).

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 4. Evansiclavelia poecilopteryx
, sp. nov. , holotype female. (a) Head, anterior view (arrow, frontal bridge); (b) head and anterior part of mesosoma, dorsal view; (c) head and mesosoma, lateral view; (d) head and mesosoma, dorsolateral view (arrow, occipital suture); (e) posterior part of mesosoma, dorsolateral view; (f) apical part of right fore tibia, medial view (arrow, apicomedial spine); (g) apical part of left fore tibia, lateral view (arrow, apicolateral spine); (h) body, legs and wings, lateral view; (i) body, part of legs and wings, dorsal view; (j) fore and hind wings; and (k) head, anteroventral view. Scale bars: 0.1 mm for (f) and (g) and 1 mm for others.

subSubSection.paragraph: T1 abruptly narrowing anteriorly with anterior face vertical and flat, fitting against propodeal declivity. Transverse groove on S2 well developed at about basal third of S2. Apical metasomal segments compressed laterally and bristly. S6 without median carina.

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 5. Australian female Ctenocerini sensu Evans (1972) other than the genera treated here. (a) Apical metasomal segments of a paratype of
Cteniziphontes protervus (Turner, 1915) (NHML)
, lateral view; (b) head of the holotype of
Apoclavelia aganippeae Evans, 1972
(ANIC), anterior view; and (c) head of the holotype of
Austroclavelia venator Evans, 1972
(ANIC), anterior view. Scale bars: 1 mm. ((a) lacks a scale bar; no measurement data available due to lack of access to the paratype.)
